column1: These are the largest parks located within the limits of the 100 largest U.S. cities. Most are owned by the municipality, but some are owned by a state, a county, a regional agency, or the federal government. If a park extends beyond the boundary of the city, only the acreage within the city is noted here.
New York's Central Park, commonly thought to be the largest city park, is number 126 at 843 acres.
